item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Searchcode.com's SQLite database is probably 6 terabytes bigger than yours (124 points | 40 comments)
2. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (732 points | 244 comments)
3. X blocks links to Signal (384 points | 264 comments)
4. A humpback whale briefly swallows kayaker in Chile (24 points | 27 comments)
5. Umami is a simple, fast, privacy-focused alternative to Google Analytics (82 points | 33 comments)
6. Representing Graphs in PostgreSQL (3 points | discuss)
7. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (368 points | 29 comments)
8. Word embeddings – Part 3: The secret ingredients of Word2Vec (106 points | 6 comments)
9. Uchū – Color palette for internet lovers (493 points | 197 comments)
10. How do modern compilers choose which variables to put in registers? (169 points | 23 comments)
11. Reflections on AGI from 1879 (6 points | discuss)
12. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (169 points | 255 comments)
13. My Time at MIT (57 points | 7 comments)
14. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (210 points | 297 comments)
15. The deadly lottery of the snakebite antivenom industry (30 points | 6 comments)
16. Flea-Scope: $18 Source Available USB Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer and More [pdf] (322 points | 98 comments)
17. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1538 points | 373 comments)
18. Is ChatGPT autocomplete bad UX/UI? (16 points | 6 comments)
19. IPv6 Is Hard (204 points | 310 comments)
20. Anno 1800: Shadows of Beauty (131 points | 27 comments)
21. Extreme supersonic winds measured on a planet outside our solar system (46 points | 22 comments)
22. Tokyo Xtreme Racer Early Access Review: We Are So Back (26 points | 4 comments)
23. Hans Bethe Stumbled Upon Perfect Quantum Theories (19 points | 1 comment)
24. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (71 points | 74 comments)
25. Gold Is Worth More in New York (89 points | 84 comments)
26. When Not to Obey Orders (2019) (128 points | 37 comments)
27. Physics Informed Neural Networks (54 points | 2 comments)
28. Javier Milei backtracks on $4.4B memecoin after 'insiders' pocket $87M (240 points | 218 comments)
29. MySQL at Uber (95 points | 39 comments)
30. Explaining my fast 6502 code generator (2023) (90 points | 17 comments)
